{{ja-kanjitab|こ|はな|さく|や|ひめ|yomi=irr}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=このはなのさくやひめ|木|tr1=ko|t1=tree|pos1=ancient combining form|の|tr2=no|pos2=possessive particle|花|tr3=hana|t3=flower|咲く|tr4=saku|t4=to bloom|や|tr5=ya|pos5=unclear, probably the ''ya'' used to form classical ''-na'' adjectives referring to the perception of a state|姫|tr6=hime|t6=princess}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|このはなのさくやひめ|yomi=irr}}
{{ja-pron|このはなのさくやびめ|yomi=irr}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|木花咲耶姫}}, {{ja-l|木花開耶姫}}

===Proper noun===
{{ja-pos|proper|このはなのさくや-ひめ|コノハナノサクヤ-ヒメ|このはなのさくや-びめ|コノハナノサクヤ-ビメ}}

# {{lb|ja|mythology|Shinto|sort=このはなのさくやひめ}} the [[goddess]] of [[Mount Fuji]], the blossom-princess and symbol of delicate earthly life
